definition: the person involved/the people holding power
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The problem is that the brain tricks the person.
sentences.chinese: 這個問題是在於大腦矇騙了當事者。

sentences.english: This show gives viewers firsthand stories from people who were at the scene.
sentences.chinese: 這個節目爲觀衆帶來當事者娓娓道來的第一手故事。

definition: sequel/continuation of a book
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
(desired) effect/(expected) result/effective
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
specious arguments/sophistry
critic/detractor
conciliation/mediation/to mollify/to propitiate/to reconcile
form of words (e.g. inflection, conjugation)/morphology (linguistics)
equivocal/ambiguous
subject
to defend sb (a relative, friend or oneself) despite knowing that that person is in the wrong
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
